skill.name: ghe-checkpoint
skill.description:
POST a progress checkpoint to the CURRENTLY ACTIVE thread. Saves work state without changing phases. Requires an already-claimed in-progress thread.

USE THIS SKILL WHEN:
- User says "post a checkpoint" or "save my progress"
- User says "update the issue" or "record current state"
- User says "checkpoint" or "save checkpoint"
- User completed a milestone and wants to record it
- User encountered a blocker and wants to document it
- User is about to take a break and wants to save state
- Meaningful state change occurred during work

PRECONDITION: User must already have an active (claimed, in-progress) thread.

DO NOT USE THIS SKILL WHEN:
- User wants to SEE status (use ghe-status)
- User wants to START work on new issue (use ghe-claim)
- User wants to FINISH current phase and MOVE to next (use ghe-transition)
- User wants reports (use ghe-report)
- No active thread exists (must claim first)

EXAMPLES:
<example>
Context: User working on DEV wants to save progress
user: "Post a checkpoint"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-checkpoint to post your current progress to the active thread"
</example>
<example>
Context: User completed a milestone
user: "Save my progress, I finished the authentication module"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-checkpoint to record this milestone"
</example>
<example>
Context: User taking a break
user: "I need to stop for now, save my work"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-checkpoint to save your current state before you go"
</example>

content.value_statement: Users lose track of work state across sessions. This skill posts progress checkpoints to GitHub Issues, preserving work context and enabling seamless continuation without changing workflow phases.
actual_capabilities: Posts progress checkpoints to currently active GitHub Issue thread
Gathers and formats work state including completed tasks and files changed
Posts to appropriate thread manager based on phase (DEV, TEST, or REVIEW)
Updates SERENA memory bank with current context
limitations: Requires an already-claimed in-progress thread to function
Does not transition phases (use ghe-transition for phase changes)
Does not provide status reports (use ghe-status for status checks)
Does not claim new issues (use ghe-claim to start work)

use_cases.title: Mid-Session Progress Save
use_cases.description: Save current work state during a long coding session to ensure no progress is lost if the session ends unexpectedly.
use_cases.target_user: Developers working on complex features who need to preserve context

use_cases.title: Milestone Documentation
use_cases.description: Record completed milestones and achievements to maintain a clear history of project progress in GitHub Issues.
use_cases.target_user: Project leads tracking feature development progress

use_cases.title: Blocker Recording
use_cases.description: Document encountered blockers with full context before taking a break, enabling efficient debugging when returning.
use_cases.target_user: Engineers debugging complex issues who need to pause work

best_practices: Post checkpoints at meaningful state changes to maintain accurate progress history
Always document blockers with full context to enable efficient debugging when returning
Use checkpoints before ending sessions to ensure seamless continuation
anti_patterns: Using ghe-checkpoint instead of ghe-transition when you need to move to the next phase
Skipping checkpoints during long sessions and only saving at the very end
Not documenting blockers when encountered, losing critical debugging context

faq.question: What is the difference between ghe-checkpoint and ghe-transition?
faq.answer: ghe-checkpoint saves progress without changing phases. ghe-transition completes the current phase and moves the issue to the next phase (DEV to TEST, TEST to REVIEW).

faq.question: Do I need to claim an issue before using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill requires an already-claimed in-progress thread. Use ghe-claim first if you do not have an active thread.

faq.question: Where are checkpoints posted?
faq.answer: Checkpoints are posted to both the GitHub Issue thread and the GHE_REPORTS directory in your project for persistent documentation.

faq.question: What information is included in a checkpoint?
faq.answer: Checkpoints include work log, completed tasks, in-progress tasks, pending tasks, files changed, commits made, current branch, blockers, and next action.

faq.question: Can I use this skill during any phase?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill adapts to the current phase (DEV, TEST, or REVIEW) and spawns the appropriate thread manager for each phase.

faq.question: Does this skill update the memory bank?
faq.answer: Yes. After posting the checkpoint, the skill spawns the memory-sync agent to update the SERENA activeContext.md file.
